name: Chicken Zafrani
keywords: Chicken Zafrani, Indian cuisine, main course, chicken recipe, saffron chicken, creamy chicken, spiced chicken, yogurt marinated chicken, chicken thigh recipe, ghee recipe, almond butter chicken, cashew butter chicken, turmeric chicken, cumin chicken, coriander chicken, garam masala, easy Indian recipe, authentic Indian recipe, dinner idea, aromatic chicken, slow cooked chicken, Mughlai chicken, party food, rich chicken curry
description: Chicken Zafrani is a rich and aromatic Indian main course featuring tender chicken thighs marinated in a flavorful blend of Greek yoghurt, garlic, ginger, lemon juice, almond and cashew butters, and a medley of traditional spices like turmeric, cumin, coriander, and chili powder. The chicken is then simmered with whole spices like cinnamon, cardamom, and star anise in ghee, and finished with a touch of heavy cream for a luscious, creamy texture. Perfect served over rice.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut chicken into bite sized pieces and put in a large bowl with the lemon juice, ginger and garlic paste.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep Chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Fry the onions in about 1 tbsp of ghee for about 10 minutes. Don't let them crisp so fry low. Throw the onion in the blender with the rest of the marinade ingredients except for yoghurt and the already used garlic, ginger, lemon.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep Onion and Blitz

recipeInstructions.text: Let the marinade cool and then mix it with the yoghurt and already marinating chicken. Leave to marinate for at least an hour.
recipeInstructions.name: Marinate

recipeInstructions.text: Melt the rest of the ghee in a large pan and add the whole spices. Let them fry for about a minute to open up their flavors. Add the chicken in and simmer for about 25-30 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook the chicken

recipeInstructions.text: After simmering, mix the cream through, season with salt to taste and serve over rice.
recipeInstructions.name: Add cream and serve

notes: Great with fresh chili and fresh coriander leaves. Can also add additional chili powder or fresh chili into the marinade.
I love to serve with more yoghurt on the side.
Works really well cooked down letting the sauce dry up.
